website_summaries.verdict: An overall good deal considering its sound quality and technology, and provided you don't get a bad unit or malfunctioning components.
pros: Stands out for its advanced technology that improves low ranges and produces exceptional base for a system of its modest size
Features Bluetooth, 5-channel surround sound, and 4K UHD HDMI inputs
cons: Somewhat confusing to pair to some devices
Several reports of faulty subwoofers and wires

customer_reviews.title: ... LG 4k TV & finding out the picture is great but speakers r crap & then buying a sound ...
customer_reviews.text: After buying a 65" LG 4k TV & finding out the picture is great but speakers r crap & then buying a sound bar to improve audio on just everyday cable tv & still audio is crap, took the plunge to buy this Yamaha amp & paired with Yamaha NS-SP1800BL 5.1 CH HTSS, now the audio on tv shows & movies is so much better & understandable. For people who look at reviews for info on watching just everyday tv with these new slim tv's the Yamaha is a must have for audio & I would recommend this unit to everyone for an intro to 5.1 surround sound at a low price for amp & speakers.l
customer_reviews.author: Barbara j Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Reciever
customer_reviews.text: Awesome receiver! Works great with my video projector and speakers sound great with this receiver. Setup with the included mic was so cool. Very happy. I researched a LOT of receivers and I am so happy that I got this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. Bluetooth connectivity for playing music from a source device is great but playing my HUGE collection of high quality mp3, etc... files from a USB flash drive is absolutely a dream come true. The files (artists, albums & songs) are all displayed on the TV screen for easy navigation. 5.1 channel movie watching is excellent as well. The YPAO auto-calibration for speaker setup is VERY nice.
customer_reviews.author: DATA SLINGER

customer_reviews.title: Budget Receiver Yet Not Quite Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Pro: -It outputs slightly amplified sound through speakers as it should. Cons: -Very under powered, too weak to even drive a very powerful self-amplified subwoofer that I had to turn it up to near max whereas on my 30 year old Denon I only needed the sub up by 4 notches. -NOT true 5.1 surround. -VERY light weight, got tiny heatsinks inside. I'm certain the capacitors aren't of decent quality either. -Bunch of useless presets lacking any real options for fine tuning. This is for those who can't differentiate between Mono vs Stereo vs Surround.
customer_reviews.author: CreamySky

customer_reviews.title: Has all the 4k and ultra hd compatibilities you need.
customer_reviews.text: Just released so I did not expect to see many reviews-but none at all? Anyway since I like Yamaha receivers and I just bought a new TCL 4K TV that was just released (The 49" 5 series 2018) I was comparing some of the newest receivers and I felt that this Yamaha gave you the best bang for the buck for a 5.1 receiver. Easy to set up sounds great and has all of the new connections and compatibilities for all 4K and Ultra HD. Don't hesitate this will work great.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Berry

customer_reviews.title: Great design, faulty unit.
customer_reviews.text: Great features, very intuitive set up. Lots of stuff is automated and very easy to use. I may have received a defective unit, however. 4k upscaling setting causes wierd image rendering issues (flashing black and white screen). I'll be calling Yamaha tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great economical, high quality surround sound receiver
customer_reviews.text: This is a great receiver for those who like quality sound without having to spend a lot of money. It has multiple features including Bluetooth, making it easy to listen to your playlist off your mobile or other device. Great unit for your 5.1 speaker setup.
customer_reviews.author: M. carter

customer_reviews.title: I returned a Sony receiver and replaced it with this, and I'm very happy I did.
customer_reviews.text: I returned a Sony receiver that promised to be capable of HDR10 but did not correctly pass HDR10 to my Xbox One X. This receiver does, and more. I love all the advanced functionality and controls the Yamaha has, that it has AUX-IN, USB -IN, and allows you to play the audio from one source over the video of another source. This receiver is great, and it was $50 cheaper than the Sony. Thank you Yamaha.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth won't pair with Bose SoundLink II headphones
customer_reviews.text: It pairs to a Fire Tablet & iphone - but won't pair to my Bose headphones. The Bose pair with every other device I've used. It even paired with a bluetooth adapter I once had. Assumed the Yamaha bluetooth would be compatible, apparently not. Good 5.1 4k receiver for the money - debating whether it's worth returning for something better that will pair with the Bose (which cost almost as much as this Yamaha did). Just kind of disappointed that it won't connect or even detect it.
customer_reviews.author: R Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Gummy & sticky Front display panel
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked & immediately disappointed. Front display panel had sticky & gummy residue. Review is NOT on performance of unit. Could not keep unit as received & not worth investing time to disconnect & reconnect current stereo system.
customer_reviews.author: Just the facts

customer_reviews.title: Good features, poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my onkyo nr-515 which died after 10 years of use. The features of this are what really drew me in. The cost point as well. It is like a Honda its very robust, output however is very sub par. The sound quality is very poor when compared to my previous receiver and i only saved less than $100 for this. In all honesty, I may throw this one away or sell for cheap in a few months. Features are great but it makes your speakers sound very cheap and unbalanced. It is actually pretty crazy how different the same speakers sound when compared
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Bad echo with tv, lot of hoops to repair.
customer_reviews.text: Unit has a gigantic echo when running telivision sound. 4 months out, company wants me to ship it back for repairs. I would be with no sound in home for who knows how long. I feel they should replace it and fix and resale. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: This receiver is obsolete. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This receiver is dysfunctional on arrival. It ships with obsolete firmware that is difficult, if not impossible, to update. Yamaha firmware updates can’t be accomplished by using an Apple product with iOS or a computer with Microsoft’s OS, using a flash/USB stick. I strongly advise NOT purchasing this OR any Yamaha product that doesn’t update wirelessly or one that you hope to use Bluetooth headphones. I have four Yamaha A/V receivers and ALL of them have significant limitations. This product is the worst. After working with Amazon support for two hours they gave up and confirmed this finding, approving a return. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Leenaars

customer_reviews.title: Everything I Need
customer_reviews.text: Paired with Elac B6.2. It sounds great for a reasonable price. The HDMI inputs are a nice feature with one HDMI output to TV. Lots of features. Everything I need. Not super customizable but that's not a big deal. Bluetooth input/output is convenient. Ran into a little trouble setting up surround but got it fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality with affective audio controls
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is better than my twelve-year-old unit that I replaced. It has a higher percentage of digital inputs then my old unit which meant I had to be a little creative in connecting my older stereo components using an audio mixer and video audio switching unit. However everything is functional and I appreciate not only the improved sound quality but the improved control over audio input and output.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Ignore complaints about audio drop-out
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of 4K pass-thru. As other have complained about, I experienced audio drop outs with older HDMI cables. Bought a pack of 4K certified HDMI cables and, whaddaya know? Drop outs disappeared. Ignore people who say that 4K cables aren't needed. Get the high-bandwidth cables. I'll add to this review the cables I ended up buying. System was the least expensive 5.1 4K AV system and I've enjoyed my previous Yamaha AV receiver for quite a while. Go for it, I would recommend to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Saucier

customer_reviews.title: Amazon should stop using neanderthal USPS to deliver electronics.
customer_reviews.text: Likes : Sounds great and easy to setup - took about 1 hour. Dislikes: Shipping was quick (1 day) but some gorilla at the USPS decided to use the shipping box as a punching bag. The result : a dented top vent on the case. No apparent functional damage (yet) so I'll take a wait and see approach if a return is needed. Note to Amazon - UPS and FedX hire intelligent and motivated employees you would do better to use them for deliveries like this
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working about 3 months after purchase
customer_reviews.text: Had problems with this unit from day 1. Bought it on July 4, 2019 and then about 2 weeks ago, I was getting no sound out of any of the speakers (5.1 setup). I did a factory reset which wiped out all my settings and figured that I must have messed something up using the setup screen. Well today (September 29, 2019) same problem. No speakers are being recognized and the phono input sounds auwful. I'm returning to Amazon and going with a different brand/model. I'm done with Yamaha.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff_from_Orange

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Caught this on sale Black Friday for $220.00 but would have paid original price worth it & sound is clear hooked to Xbox One X PS4 Pro & Fire Cube Everything In 4K ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product.  Terrible service
customer_reviews.text: Zero stars! This product did not work from the get go. Immediately after installation, the sound blared as loudly as possible. The only way to stop it was to shut it down completely. Initially this happened rarely, but as the weeks passed, it became more frequent. So, I tried to return/exchange it only to find that I was THREE DAYS beyond the one month exchange deadline. Neither amazon nor Yamaha was helpful at all. My best option was to send in the receiver to get refurbed.. The cost of shipping plus the long wait had been prohibitive. So I’m stuck with this hunk of junk. I’ve never been so dissatisfied with an amazon purchase
customer_reviews.author: Lee B.

customer_reviews.title: Best 5.1 receiver value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Yamaha because of a very positive experience with another Yamaha that I use in my main setup. This new one is for use in a bedroom where I didn't want to spend a lot. Yamaha has done it again. For the price, I don't believe you can find a better 5.1 receiver. Great sound, great features, easy to learn remote functions. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GGFWindsor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound for the money
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a much more expensive Yamaha home theater receiver that quit working with this one. To my surprise, it sounds a little better than the more expensive model did! It lacks the network connectivity, so the remote control apps for your phone are not available for this model. It's not a big deal, but I do like having all my remotes as apps on my phone and iPad. I miss not having the integrated Apple Play and other internet/network content and features. However, for HDMI-connected devices, it handles the sound very well. As for Bluetooth... it works about as well as Bluetooth ever works. I prefer to have the ethernet connectivity, though.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ellisberg

customer_reviews.title: First one was defective, giving #2 a try
customer_reviews.text: I had great hopes for the RX-V385 but within a week of buying it, started having lip-synch issues, system settings related CPU lock ups, remote failures and other issues. Online forums indicated a tendency for CPU freeze and recommended firmware update (accomplished) and resets. All completed, none solved the problem. Due to its high ratings, I returned the first unit for a replacement. Just finished installing unit #2 - seems to be working well (for the first 6 hours). Reliability or quality control may not be the strong suit of this system but Amazon support was flawless. Will follow up in a few weeks if it keeps working properly.
customer_reviews.author: SteveinMA

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old Yamaha receiver with this new one since mine didn’t have an HDMI. This one was so easy to hook up and even automatically synced with my Apple TV remote. It also looks great! The top part is glass and it looks so much more modern then my old one. I also like that the controls are pretty much identical to my old Yamaha receiver so it’s easy to make the switch without having to relearn everything.
customer_reviews.author: NikLu

customer_reviews.title: Dialogue came alive.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Yamaha RX V473. It was similar but this one just sounds better while watching movies. The remote layout is much cleaner and sound setup was easy with YPAO. Music was good on the previous 473 and music and Theatre are great with RXV 385. I would recommend this reciever and believe it to be a great value as well.
customer_reviews.author: alan k

customer_reviews.title: PROBLEMS
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS YAMAHA AS I HAD ONE FOR ABOUT 12 YEARS AND THAT ONE STARTED CUTTING IN AND OUT....WELL I HAVE HAD THIS ABOUT A LITTLE OVER A MONTH AND THIS STARTED CUTTING IN AND OUT...AFTER GOING ONLINE AND SEEING PEOPLE WITH THE SAME PROBLEM I AM UPSET......I AM NOT HAVING A TECH COME IN AND AND GO THROUGH WHAT OTHER PEOPLE HAVE DEALT WITH....CAN'T TRUST ANYTHING TODAY..DON'T BUY YAMAHA
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha is the best
customer_reviews.text: This receiver is an upgrade for an old Yamaha receiver I've had for close to 10 years. My old one still works but it was built before HDMI was everywhere. This new one is beautiful and sounds great. My only problem was figuring out the instructions. The menus are complicated and the owners manual is very long. It takes time to sort everything out. I spent less time hooking everything up than I did figuring out all the options and settings. This is the best inexpensive receiver around. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney E.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t blow your speakers
customer_reviews.text: Just hooked it up to my current so round sound speaker system out new home cane with . My kids are like dad that’s awesome ! Sound great. Well built and easy least set up !! Comes with batteries for the remote witch is a plus since AAA are not a better I keep on hand . Great job Yamaha!!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level receiver
customer_reviews.text: If you don't need more bells and whistles, this receiver will get the job done very well. It really shines on video pass through and added more pop to my Panny St50 Plasma TV. Audio quality is also outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Chef B

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound but the Inputs are confusing. I wish they were named. Cable Box, Blue Ray Etc.
customer_reviews.text: It is Hard to figure out what Input is being used by the display. There are four Outlets not Identified Except as AV1 AV2 etc. and when you are using the remote, there are about 12 choices, and It is hard to know what the hell you are choosing. I Also had it on the Input with the Cable box and got no Picture. When I did get a picture the quality was terrible, I just plugged it back into the TV Directly. I will Use an Optical Cable for the TV Sound!
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hook up to my computer to in HDMI pass-through, and for that purpose it works very well. Additional features like Bluetooth were really just a plus. Unfortunately, I found the Bluetooth to be effectively unusable, as there is no way to pair it with my phone. So I'm knocking off one star for the bone-headed Bluetooth implementation. But in terms of sound quality and ease of setup, I'll give it 5 stars. Pro's: Great sound quality Use of banana plugs dramatically simplifies speaker hookup. Fairly simple user interface, although it could have been done a little better. Con's: Unusable Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha doesn't disappoint. Plus 4K Upscaling!
customer_reviews.text: Great A/V receiver. Awesome sound. Very user friendly. There is a whole bunch of useful menu options and settings to fiddle with. If you don't have a 4K tv yet, like me, the HDMI upscaling option takes 1080p and turns it into 4K. I didn't think my picture could get any better. I was sooooo wrong. It's like I got a new tv too. One thing tho, the receiver recognized my Samsung Blu Ray (model # and everything) and I can control the blu ray with the Yamaha remote(which is nice) BUT the Yamaha remote won't control my Yamaha CD player and both are new. Weird.
customer_reviews.author: linnear

customer_reviews.title: Great Reciver
customer_reviews.text: I have another Yamaha receiver that has been in use for 11 years without any problems, so when it came time to replace another receiver that was no longer performing, I chose this Yamaha to replace it, and I am certainly glad I did. Even my wife, who normally does not comment on such things, commented on how much better the sound was than on the receiver it replaced. This is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bunch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent receiver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade from my old RX-V663. Not a lot has changed aside from improved on-screen menus and newer HDMI support, which is a good thing considering that the V663 was a reliable and powerful receiver, and this one is no different. A welcome addition is the built-in bluetooth support allowing me to easily/wirelessly play music from my phone. Setup/calibration is easy once you get the speakers connected through the use of the included calibration microphone. Overall this is an excellent receiver that will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M. Girard

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver
customer_reviews.text: A very nice receiver for the price. I use it generally for home theater and for connecting my phone via Bluetooth for music. Easy set up with some nice, simple to use and great sounding audio features. And if you're really into it, you can delve pretty deeply into the audio and video settings in the on screen menu - on the receiver screen OR on your TV as well, which is really cool. All of the home theater settings sound amazing through my Polk Audio speakers and Polk Audio PSW10 subwoofer (I reviewed that one too). I recommend this unit very highly.
customer_reviews.author: RLMiller

customer_reviews.title: Terrible documentation.
customer_reviews.text: The quick start that comes with this product is worthless. To get it to work I had to download the manual off the net, read through many pages of circular reasoning, and when I finally got to about 170 pages they told me how to turn on the HDMI. Forcing people to go through so many pages of poorly written material to get to the most fundamental function was in my mind inexcusable. When I finally got it set up it sounded good momentarily, but would lose and rre-gain the signal about 1 time per second. No exaggeration! Back it went. I will avoid this manufacturer in the future
customer_reviews.author: Fred P

customer_reviews.title: Great System
customer_reviews.text: This, combined with my new Klipsch speaker system makes me never want to leave my house again.
customer_reviews.author: RBoz

customer_reviews.title: Good sound Quality 4K HDMI receiver
customer_reviews.text: Paired with a BIC powered subwoofer and Polk bookshelf, center and in ceiling surround speakers I get great sound in my 400 sq ft living room. HDMI connectivity with HDR is good and the user interface works well. The included microphone allows automatic center balancing for all 5.1 speakers. Remote is pretty good with 4 custom buttons. Can be controlled with other equipment, using mine with XBox OneX, AppleTV, Amazon FireTV and Nintendo WiiU. Optical audio in allows TV audio back in but I haven’t used that or the Bluetooth options
customer_reviews.author: Hanko

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound Quality!
customer_reviews.text: After my 15 year old receiver (different brand) quit working for the second time, instead of taking it to get it repaired again, I decided it was almost the same price to replace as it was to repair. I was told by some TV/audio experts that Yamaha was an excellent choice. So after reading the reviews on this one, I decided on this RX-V385 model. The sound quality is excellent, and it was easy for me to set up. I'm so happy I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to replace an old Pioneer VSX-821, the Pioneer had a lot of issues switching between sources and dropping audio, sometimes just watching shows on Hulu or Netflix first episode would play fine, next episode bam no audio. Setup was easy, on screen menus display via HDMI vs needing to hookup a composite cable for the old Pioneer, sound is clean and it's auto setup using its microphone delivered good results. All the format switching issues are gone. Hopefully it lasts as long as the old Pioneer did, but I've had good luck with other Yamaha gear so I'm not too worried. I only have a 5.1 setup so this was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Peeler

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful receiver! I can't believe all the features at this price point. Very easy to set up. It has yet to get hot in my cabinet, I haven't even needed to use the cabinet fans I intalled for my old Sony unit! It immediately recognized my fire tv, Nintendo switch, and PS4. It is running polk speakers and a sub, sounds fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Raging45

customer_reviews.title: Suround system?????
customer_reviews.text: No mater what I'm setting, I can hear (sort of) sound going from bask speakers, but it is not SURROUND effect. When airplane taking of runway, I can hear it going over my head when I'm using my old SONY receiver. NOT from this Yamaha crap. It will be returned soon. Do not buy this device if you really know how surround system should work. You'll be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Amazon warehouse deals!
customer_reviews.text: Beware of Amazon warehouse deal! This is the second item I’ve bought from their warehouse deals that doesn’t work! The first item was a guitar pedal that had been “ repaired” by gluing it together. I spent 35 minutes on hold for the Yamaha representative to tell me that this receiver is a faulty unit. Now I have to deal with the hassle of returning this. I’m guessing they will probably “fix it” and sell it to another person as a warehouse deal.
customer_reviews.author: kla

customer_reviews.title: Surroundsound
customer_reviews.text: I like this Yamaha. I wish I would of bought a Warranty with it. The only reason why is I bought a refurbished Yamaha I paid a lot of money for it through Amazon and I take it in twice to have it repaired. Now since I bought the new one I thought maybe I won’t have the same problem. So I’m praying. I thought of a cool Amazon Monday morning to see if I can’t put a warranty on it just to be safe than sorry. I like this Yamaha very much so I really want to put a warranty on it.
customer_reviews.author: James J Frio Jr

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, but.....
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get AV receiver to pair with my Samsung smart TV (about a year old). Setup process didn't detect my Amazon Firestick. Hand control setup complex and was unable to integrate TV, Bluetooth DVD player, and Firestick. Owners manual so general and vague, rendering it nearly useless.
customer_reviews.author: Maryfran

customer_reviews.title: Full Rich Sound.
customer_reviews.text: This AV reciever is easy to set up and has full rich sound. I originally purchased a Denon AVR-S640h that I returned because it sounded so bad and would not sync the lips on AV. I could not be happier with the set up. This AV system is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: GeekStick

customer_reviews.title: Second one I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a RX-V285 that I sold a while back. Bought this one to go with some new speakers and sub I bought. This has held up very well and seems to work just as well as the V285 did, plus I get 4k outputs on it which I didnt have before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Happy With this HT AV Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this HT AV receiver. I had a Onkio SR-636 that finally quit working after 15 years. This Yamaha sounds really good and has lot of volume. Clearly better than the Onkio I had. I couldn't get the Bluetooth to pair with my Galaxy Note 8 but that isn't a deal breaker for me. I didn't need a 7.1, 9.1 so this 5.1 was my choice. I've been using it for about a month and don't regret my purchase at all because this unit will get really loud and sounds great. If something changes I will up date this review. I recommend this Yamaha.
customer_reviews.author: D. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great value and excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: Looking to replace a receiver that I had for over 10+ years. This receive was easy to set up. It has a sufficient number of HDMI outputs. The sound quality is superb. I also find the auto shut off feature to be nice in case I forget to turn it off. It is also nice to have the unit turn on automatically when connecting a Bluetooth device to stream audio. Great features for the value.
customer_reviews.author: Mark V

customer_reviews.title: Great value, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Had an old receiver decked out for full 7.1 setup, but needed a smaller setup with just 2 main large speakers, one central (voice) one. This fit the bill splendidly. Yamaha makes instruments, a big reason for choosing it. Hooked it up to an LG OLED TV through ARC, and all works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Paolo Pignatelli

customer_reviews.title: Great if your just getting into Home theater
customer_reviews.text: Replaced Home theater I bought circa 2006 when Dolby digital and DTS was just hitting the home end. This update was sorely needed and with every penny. Paired with a matching 5 speaker set and a JBL sub I couldn't be happier. At this price point Yamaha hit one out of the park
customer_reviews.author: G Champlin

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my receiver about two weeks ago. The set up was easier than I thought. I have surround sound speakers in my ceilings so I only used the surround wire connectors. Since my tv was already mounted, I didn’t want to have the HDMI cord showing so I connected the receiver to my Dish Hopper via Bluetooth. I know I’m not getting the full quality doing it this way but the sound quality is still really good. I’ve only had a couple issues with the sound being ahead of the tv but the lip sync corrected it. I’m completely satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CarlaJevonne

customer_reviews.title: Very nice budget receiver for home theater
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice, budget model receiver amplifier that has the latest 4K specs and support. The unit sound quality is very good, and it supports all of my peripheral devices. It has slightly less wattage then my previous receiver amplifier, but it's sufficient for my home theater enjoyment. It seems to sync automatically with other devices which makes its operation convenient and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Konga76

customer_reviews.title: Excellent support
customer_reviews.text: I really love this keyboard. Great tactile feel from the key. Looks great and comes with a very nice mouse. I did have a small issue 6 months in with a couple keys only producing lower case, except when using CAP LOCK. Nevertheless, I still gave it 5 stars for 2 reasons. First, the price/value is superb, and second, Victsing responded within 24 hours to back up the product with a free replacement. No arguments, no questions, just provision of the Amazon order #.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality 4K receiver, best at its price point
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this purchase. Supports full resolution 4K passthrough which easily allows for control over multiple devices. Comes with many presents that change the sound drastically. Allows for very precise customization of sound. A little pricey but still far cheaper than other similar quality recievers.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Stearns

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I really like the AVR. Comes with a mic that enables it to calibrate for your room/setup. I had a problem where the AVR video output to the tv would blink everytime my A/C condenser compressor would start up outside so I had to get a uninterruptible power supply to keep the power to it steady. Also the whole top of the avr has slots to allow heat out but I just feel like it should be screened or something because dust is just going to go in there.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Gets very hot!
customer_reviews.text: This receiver produces a very good sound and has good functionality. But, stay away from this receiver if you have little space to put it in. The unit gets very hot even when playing a low volumes! I returned it for this reason and I have since bought another brand with similar functions an it does not get anywhere near as hot as the Yamaha.
customer_reviews.author: Anderse

customer_reviews.title: Setup App does not clearly show how to connect to TV
customer_reviews.text: My setup is simple: TV (with HDMI ARC support), Blueray player and this receiver. The setup App shows to connect Receiver's HDMI OUT to TV's HDMI IN, but it should say connect to TV's HDMI ARC. Took me a while to figure this out. The sound is OK compared with my 20-year old receiver. I have no overheating so far like others reported. If you are looking for a replacement of old receivers like mine, this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound
customer_reviews.text: This works well in my home theater system. I'm not a super power user so this is sufficiently powerful enough. I bought this to replace my previous unit which was the prior model. The prior unit served me well for many years before it failed. So, basically, I am a repeat customer. The last unit went for 6 years with light use (average 2 hours per day at normal volume). I hope this unit to last at least 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Expert_Review

customer_reviews.title: Value for your money
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Bose 5.1 surround system since 2001. Since connecting them to this unit they have never sounded better. I understand everyone's sense of hearing differs, but for the price this receiver brings music to my ears.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Murray

customer_reviews.title: The perfect inexpensive 4K receiver
customer_reviews.text: I needed an inexpensive 4K receiver for my office to connect my TV, Nvidia Shield, and audio components together. I have had several Yamaha receivers and this one is just like the others: nice quality and trouble-free. If you don't need anything more than a 5.1 channel receiver with 4K and Bluetooth, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Juniorverse

customer_reviews.title: Nice price/performance receiver
customer_reviews.text: This receiver does 99% of everything I needed in a receiver and doesn't break the bank. My last Yamaha got zapped in a storm along with some other AV equipment so I was looking for something on the lower end in price that still sounded good with my Ascend speakers and HSU sub. Happy with this unit for both music and movies.
customer_reviews.author: Castello

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reciever
customer_reviews.text: I have a Denon that cost almost 3 times the price and while yes the Denon is better I think this Yamaha is fantastic for the price. It has all the stuff needed for a great home theater experience with a lot less cost. The Bluetooth portion works perfectly both for receiving and transmitting to headphones, etc. I'm streaming audio from my phone to the receiver while writing this.
customer_reviews.author: 3dprnt

customer_reviews.title: 1st Yamaha product and I'm a fan
customer_reviews.text: Started with a Pioneer but watching movies was not fun, between scenes had to have my finger on the volume to control the obnoxious change in volume. I researched and found that Yamaha had a Dynamic range control setting that has helped a lot! Also has a Dialogue setting too which helps. So far a much more enjoyable experience. One more thing is a world of difference in things being user friendly compared to the Pioneer. Changing setting is the way it should be. Thank you Yamaha
customer_reviews.author: WILL ANDREW

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend... Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Received item and it never worked. Not even static. Tried multiple times to contact Yamaha, but no one answered phone on three different days. Always the same message /excuse 15 in line ahead of you, 24 in line ahead of you, 25 in line ahead of you... I even tried having them hold place in line, still waiting days later; never called.
customer_reviews.author: Frances

customer_reviews.title: Muffled sound
customer_reviews.text: Muffled sound. It has lots of bells and whistles. But what good are they when my clock radio sounds better no matter which soundscape is chosen? The treble and bass controls barely alter the sound when adjusting either one from -6 to + 6. It is quite surprising that Yamaha would put its name on this terrible sounding device.
customer_reviews.author: William Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great Product at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: if you are looking for a receiver to use bi-amp speakers, then this is the one. I thought I was going to have to get one that was higher then 5.1 ch. This is perfect for what I needed. Easy to use. its an upgrade from my previous Yamaha receiver. I am well pleased. I highly recommend this to anyone needing an inexpensive receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Just my opinion

customer_reviews.title: Over complicated setup
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I had high expectations that Yamaha didn’t meet. Have an older model and was hoping to replace it with one less complicated and this was worst though newer. Though was able to connect Bluetooth was let down when trying to connect the CD player. Very disappointed. Plan on never purchasing anything from Yamaha again.
customer_reviews.author: George1914

customer_reviews.title: A great unit for the price
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a 15 year old JVC and am glad I did. Power is enough but not overwhelming. Hookups were plentiful and easy. Sound programs are too many for my needs and I settle for the basic 5.1 and drama modes. I would have given it 5 stares but i'm sure there are better units for a price out there.
customer_reviews.author: Shiprex

customer_reviews.title: Everything you can ask for at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the receiver. I use it for anything and everything that sound related. I have JBL Cinema 6.1 home theater speakers running through it and sounds great, room shaking. As far as bluetooth capabilities works very well. I had a little problem connecting a Samsung galaxy phone at first. But my wife was able to connect right away with a Apple. Can watch all streaming services with Chromecast without any problems. Just plug it into a HDMI port in the back and stream away. Can also Amazon music sounds awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Simple setup, easy to use features
customer_reviews.text: Very straightforward receiver to use (5.1 dolby) and an easy to use and understand menu system. I used the included microphone to get my Klipsch Quintet III speakers balanced, then fine-tuned by ear. The Yamaha equalizer settings are also very simple to use. Haven't used the bluetooth feature, have no need for it.
customer_reviews.author: fredstev

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a couple of months ago and love it to death. The power that it has is so evident compared to my old receiver. When I was hooking it up my sister was outside and knocked on the door and said she could hear it outside. I told her I only had one speaker hooked up. When I got all my speakers set up the sound is like being in a theater or at a rock concert. I'm sure my neighbors don't care much for it but I am so glad I purchased this one.
customer_reviews.author: robby malpass

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: For a budget receiver this thing does it all. I have it connected to my Onkyo speakers and subwoofer and it gets LOUD. So many features are packed into it. In my personal experience it has never overheated once in since I got it about 6 months ago. 4K capability along with ARC a plus for this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Receiver
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy for a Yamaha branded receiver... only thing it misses is a Network connection (no Ethernet or Wireless) ... sound quality is excellent. I run all my devices through it (TiVo, Roku, and Amazon 4K Fire stick) and I think it enhances the picture as well.... would have been nice for one more HDMI port in the front next to the USB...
customer_reviews.author: H. Dieterich

customer_reviews.title: Everything I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Seems good so far. The ARC makes it easy to use once I figured out which input to select. Drives my speakers and sub adequately. Bluetooth syncs easily. Run most movies at a volume to where it easily handles it.
customer_reviews.author: Offsure

customer_reviews.title: you know I'm not be disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: Really good amp for the price deliver for an outstanding 5 speaker sound sounds much like the older to type apps love the sound
customer_reviews.author: Doris

customer_reviews.title: Good stereo receiver
customer_reviews.text: This receiver works well and, most important to me, has the connectivity to my other components. I'm not crazy about the various sound profiles but found several that work well for me. Also the price is up there, but the quality of the sound and the connectivity are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. J. Zercher

customer_reviews.title: It works as intended
customer_reviews.text: I bought the RX-V 385 for exactly what it was intended for: switching HDMI sources for my projector. I tried two of the HDMI boxes/switches that you were supposed to get the audio out of HDMI cable source but none of them worked! No wonder none of the reputable manufacturers make such things. So, I bought the Yamaha RX-V 385. It was pretty easy to setup; just follow the instructions. Of course, it's not a high end receiver but it does what it was supposed to do for me: switching HDMI sources...
customer_reviews.author: Sean Y

customer_reviews.title: A Really Excellent System!
customer_reviews.text: Basically everything I was looking for in a mid-cost surround sound amplifier. Works well with my Bose speaker system and connects well with the TV and various Bluetooth devices. Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Elliott Mendenhall

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, great surround sound!
customer_reviews.text: No cons so far. Very easy to set up. Hardest part was the darn speaker connections but most of that's on me because I set it up with existing speaker connections. Surround sound set-up with the microphone us incredible. So easy did it twice to make sure I did it correctly. Highly recommend this receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Deal

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sound and quality. I trust Yamaha.
customer_reviews.text: This is an upgrade of my 10 year old Yamaha AV I loved. It produces excellent sound quality but adds new technology such a 4K and bluetooth my previous one didn't. I'm very happy with Yamaha and use my unit with Polk Audio surround speakers with subwoofer in a 5.1 setup.
customer_reviews.author: ginsing

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic low cost receiver!
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly pleased with this receiver. I use it in my garage to power my Klipsch 5.1 system and stream music from my phone while working on the cars, doing maintenance, detailing... I have it in NewAge cabinet and as hot as it's been this summer it delivers high volume, high quality sound without overheating.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Servant

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Had in my mind that I was going to buy a Denon. But when I checked out the reviews I decided to go with the Yamaha. The power output is just right for my small living room. I wanted something with HDMI ins and outs and this works great. I couldn't seem to find to find a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: wayne sutton

customer_reviews.title: I prolly wouldn’t buy one
customer_reviews.text: Well I have had the product for about 7 months and all of a sudden it just quit working. I did some research and found out that the relay went out so now I have a broke receiver. That I can’t fix and don’t ask where to send it to get it replaced or fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Aj B.

customer_reviews.title: A great unit for a small family room
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to connect a sound system in my family room. The room itself is relatively small (approx. 10x14) and this unit powers the speakers for a full room experience. This is my second Yamaha receiver and am really happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Quad

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This product solves a lot of the issues we had with our old onkyo system. We use it in a 5 speaker system (no subwoofer yet). Its user interface is easy to understand and I got it up and running in about an hour. One thing that was frustrating was a loss of signal between this and our Roku. Turned out to be an issue on Rokus end and a couple adjustments fixed it quickly. All in all great for the price
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mock

customer_reviews.title: Use the biamp and all the  menus and sub-menus
customer_reviews.text: Great entry level amp to better sound and options. Bi-amped the AV receiver to Q Acoustic 3050’s speakers, which are also a great product into entry level high end speakers. Speakers are 25 feet apart and after using the biamp capability of the amp and speakers they sound very good. It’s worth the time to really go thru the menus and submenus of the receiver to tweak the sound to you like it. Good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: NC@VA

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so we could upgrade our TV signal to 4K. It replaced a much more expensive Yamaha unit we had originally purchased that couldn't handle 4K, and so far it's exceeded our expectations. Easy to use, good sound quality and it passes a 4K signal.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Rose

customer_reviews.title: very easy to hook up  need hdmi cable and  audio optical cable  for  tv and set top box hookup
customer_reviews.text: great sound have purchased 2 of these in last couple years they replaced 2 much older jvc ones which were also fine for the times these seem much more updated they also come with small micraphone and long cord which you plug in to the yamaha and it automaticly adjusts all spakers in room
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Stevens

customer_reviews.title: I DON' RECOMMEND THIS WITH A LG TV
customer_reviews.text: I have to fight with this receiver every time I try to use it with my 2019 LG TV and it take all the fun out of it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Great reciever
customer_reviews.text: These are great receivers. Replace a 20 year old JVC. The change in technology is incredible. I've seen a lot of folks complaining that the reciever didn't work with their new TV. You need to concentrate on the TV settings. Not just in settings but you need to go into the system menu when using the ARC imput. Took me two hours to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to sit up. Has good options and settings are modifiable. Great sound quality. I was initially afraid that the lower wattage per speaker would be an issue, but I have noticed that the sound is very good and plenty loud compared to my older Yamaha receiver with higher wattage. The lower price and value make this a strong recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: N. D. Tor

customer_reviews.title: Great, affordable HT AMP
customer_reviews.text: Works great.. nice sound and video switching capabilities. Remote is OK as I wish it was a learning/unv. type remote and also backlit for ease of use. Yamaha always has made great HT products. Solid solution for me for the price.....
customer_reviews.author: Dan  Bel Air MD

customer_reviews.title: GREAT RECEIVER
customer_reviews.text: con : a bit hard to connect to tv however then have a live phone line who wil walk you through the process. Pro : totally integrates with the tv ....great sound.......fills the room with sound....very adaptable to any shape of room since each speaker can be customized through the menu... when using the tv the remote for the receiver is not needed all controlled thru the comcast remote. LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: John R. Panseri

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Everything working perfectly and was easy to setup. It performs exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: John B. - Independence, MO

customer_reviews.title: Best for the budget
customer_reviews.text: I tried a couple of different models in this price range and had terrible luck with Onkyo and Pioneer, both were bad right out of the box. This Yamaha is outstanding, the picture quality is great, the audio is wonderful. It set up very easy and the the customization really makes this one worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny S.

customer_reviews.title: Can not plug-in older RCA type turntable or CD player.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that the receiver only has HDMI connections. We can not plug in our turntable or CD player. It also does not have an A & B separate speakers button. If we want to listen to music in our patio, we would need to buy a separate A & B switch. I'm sure that the system is great and can put a man on the moon so-to-speak but am disappointed that it only accepts latest equipment.
customer_reviews.author: mikesecor

customer_reviews.title: works ok.
customer_reviews.text: packaging it came in sucked, and the receiver had a couple of dings and bends that was not expected , but fixed it. works good but haven't tested all the features.
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Great Reciever ... Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from an old receiver ... I've had for the past 15 years or so, I primarily use it for listening to music. I love the USB feature. I have a lot of CDs ( Jazz and R&B). I transfer to a USB thumb drive and use with my new Yamaha receiver. The sound quality is outstanding on my old Bose book shelf speakers.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: A very good low-tier receiver!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old Insignia NS-STR514 2.1 Receiver and went with a Yamaha because I've had great experiences with their receivers in the past. All around, this is a good receiver. I have had no issues with it so far, and I haven't noticed any 'overheating' like some other reviews have pointed out. It may be that it's not old enough for it to start happening, but until that happens, I will continue to be happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Josie

product_meta.title: Yamaha RX-V385 5.1-Channel 4K Ultra HD AV Receiver with Bluetooth
product_meta.description: Style:ReceiverUncompromising value. This 5.1-Channel AV receiver brings the best technologies to your home including Dolby vision, 4K Ultra HD, HDR10 and Bluetooth at an affordable price. Standby Power Consumption (IR only): ≤ 0.2 W.
feature_bullets: Bluetooth for wireless connectivity. Rated Output Power (1kHz, 1ch driven) 100 W (8 ohms, 0.9% THD); Rated Output Power (20Hz 20kHz, 2ch driven) 70 W (8 ohms, 0.09% THD); Maximum Effective Output Power (1kHz, 1ch driven) (Jeita) 145 W (6 ohms, 10% THD)
4K Ultra HD support, HDR10, Dolby vision, hybrid log gamma and BT. 2020

Providing complete compatibility with the latest HDMI standards, this AV receiver delivers transmission of 4K video at 60 frames/second pass through; It also supports HDR (high dynamic range) Video including Dolby Vision and Hybrid Log Gamma which provides incredible contrast, smooth tone and rich, bright colors

YPAO auto calibration technology for ideal sound, Exclusive Yamaha Cinema DSP technology supports playback of HD Audio (Dolby TrueHD, DTS HD Master Audio , etc.), providing natural and expansive sound imaging

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars808 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
